column9: i have used this medication for several years and untill recently have had o issueshowever i will be consulting my physcian, i have stepped up my effort to loose weight by changing my diet and riding a bicycle for about 3 months.within in the last 2 weeks i have noticed a change while riding. i have had to use my rescue inhailer a few times.im hoping its only a cold or infection.prior to the medication works great along with my azmacort inhailer.

column1: Bronchi Muscle Spasm resulting from COPD
column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: using forasil for 18 months in place of advair. I also use asmanex with it. this was provided by the V.A and seems to work fairly well.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication was HORRIBLE for me. I had a massive negative reaction causing insomnia, panic attacks, and worsening of my asthma. I discontinued after 2 days. I highly, highly reccommend thoroughly discussing with your doctor other options. I am actually amazed that they placed me on this drug as I had heart palpitations with the Advair and they are in the same drug class. I am now on an anti-anxiety med and cannot wait for this junk to clear my system.

column2: WESLEY, 75 or over Male  (Patient)

column1: Bronchi Muscle Spasm resulting from COPD
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: this drug is the best i've taken for my copd it has helped me so much i can now do the things i've stopped doing do to my illness now i'm free

column2: bj30out, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using Foradil for over 2 years.  It is by far the best asthma medication I've ever taken.  However, I notice a gradual shortness of breath and chest pressure if I miss a dose or it's longer than 12 hrs. since my last inhilation.  I'm wondering if it's addictive ! Also, I just read that it shouldn't be taken as the only treatment for asthma.  I only have to use my albuterol inhaler on occasion, mostly when I forget to take the Foradil.  I'm getting a bit concerned about continuing to use this medication.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have  been taking this med about 1 week and I am so exhausted it is all I can do to stay awake all day.  I am a very high energy person, not anymore I am half asleep all day does anyone have a remedity for this problem?  Other than that it is great.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I use this as need for difficulty with breathing associated with Allergies/bronchospasms. I have exprienced some shaking/tremors and tiredness/fatigue. This is short lived.  There is no comparison to the relief I experience vs the side effects.  I have had no blood sugar change or issues.

column2: mgmike123@aol.com, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Prior to taking this drug I would get extreme shortness of breath and abdominal spasms from the shortest distance I had to walk. After taking this drug I am able to resume my normal daily activity of walking and gardening.  I am using this in conjunction with a water pill (furosemide and Micardis-HCT) all twice a day.

column2: jiksgx, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: While I experiences relief from asthma symptoms, I experienced tremors and nervousness. I discontinued after three days.

column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am taking this med for COPD in leiu of the albuteral treatment by mask. I no longer have to use the albuteral treatments. It along with Spiriva appears to be working for me. Shortness of breath continues to be a problem when exercising. Also, I am experencing some dizziness occassionally.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: more effective than other meds i have been prescribed. easy to use. have usedfor about 4 months and my breathing hasdefinitely improved. no side effects so far.

column2: BOB, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Mom_of_Four, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Foradil changed my life!  One inhaled capsule in the morning, and I'm symptom-free all day. Another one before bed if needed.  A lifetime of meds and regimens replaced by these little capsules. I haven't noticed blood sugar or fatigue issues, like some users.  I tell everyone I know how wonderful this drug is!

column9: easier on my throat than Advair. Still too expensive for a maintenance drug.Has anyone experienced weight gain with this?

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken theophylline pills twice a day for twenty years. I was put on Foradil along with Asthmanex to replace the theophylline and I can't believe the effects. I can breathe better than when I was only taking the theophylline. I was very skeptical about stopping the theophylline "cold turkey". However, I have had no withdrawal symptoms and my breathing is great.
